decision_conditions: GRANTED WITH CONDITIONS: T1,T2,T3, T6 and T7 - The works should be carried out to the latest requirement of British Standard 3998

"Recommendations for Tree Work" | REFUSE: T4, T5, T8,T9,T10, T11, T12 - Cutting back to the boundary line will go beyond the recommendations set out in British Standard 3998:2010 Tree Work - Recommendations, section 7.7.2.  Healthy and structurally sound trees are capable of tolerating crown reductions of 30% of leaf volume, which is detailed as approximately 12% of branch length (allowing for variation in species).  The proposed works go well beyond this maximum level and as no information has been provided to show special/exceptional reasons (subsidence damage, structural damage to the tree, etc.) for such a level of reduction the works are refused.
description:
Tree 1 (Apple) - remove storm damaged tree. T
Tree 2 (Poplar)- remove the epicormic growth sprouts.  
Tree 3 (Ash)-cut back the branches overhanging  and risk of falling, remove dead limb.
Tree 6 (Sycamore)- remove dead stump
Tree 7 (Sycamore)-remove dead tree to prevent risk of falling. 
Sycamore  cut back the branches overhanging
